verses.roman:
yady apy anusmaran vairaṁ
rukmī kṛṣṇāvamānitaḥ
vyatarad bhāgineyāya
sutāṁ kurvan svasuḥ priyam

synonyms: yadi api—although; anusmaran—always remembering; rukmī—Rukmī; kṛṣṇa—by Lord Kṛṣṇa; avamānitaḥ—insulted; vyatarat—granted; bhāgineyāya—to his sister's son; sutām—his daughter; kurvan—doing; svasuḥ—of his sister; priyam—the pleasing.
translation: Though Rukmī always remembered his enmity toward Lord Kṛṣṇa, who had insulted him, in order to please his sister he sanctioned his daughter's marriage to his nephew.

purport.content: The answer to King Parīkṣit's question is given here. Ultimately Rukmī approved his daughter's marriage to Pradyumna in order to please his sister, Rukmiṇī.
